intro: Stigmatodactylus dalagangpalawanicum, commonly known as the Palawan stigmatodactylus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to habitat loss, this species is considered endangered and is of significant botanical interest for its endemic status.
